user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is: The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of try_get_value:
```c
static void
try_get_value (const char *buf,
               const char *key,
               char **destination)
{
  const char *spos;
  const char *bpos;
  const char *endv;
  size_t klen;
  size_t vlen;

  if (NULL != *destination)
    return;
  bpos = buf;
  klen = strlen (key);
  while (NULL != (spos = strstr (bpos, key)))
  {
    if ( (spos[klen] != '=') ||
         ( (spos != buf) &&
           (spos[-1] != ' ') ) )
    {
      /* no match */
      bpos = spos + 1;
      continue;
    }
    if (spos[klen + 1] != '"')
      return;                   /* not quoted */
    if (NULL == (endv = strchr (&spos[klen + 2],
                                '\"')))
      return;                   /* no end-quote */
    vlen = (size_t) (endv - spos) - klen - 1;
    *destination = malloc (vlen);
    if (NULL == *destination)
      return;                   /* out of memory */
    (*destination)[vlen - 1] = '\0';
    memcpy (*destination,
            &spos[klen + 2],
            vlen - 1);
    return;                     /* success */
  }
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function try_get_value:
int
MHD_str_equal_caseless_n_ (const char *const str1,
                           const char *const str2,
                           size_t maxlen)
{
  size_t i;

  for (i = 0; i < maxlen; ++i)
  {
    const char c1 = str1[i];
    const char c2 = str2[i];
    if (0 == c2)
      return 0 == c1;
    if (charsequalcaseless (c1, c2))
      continue;
    else
      return 0;
  }
  return ! 0;
}
...
static int
process_multipart_headers (struct MHD_PostProcessor *pp,
                           size_t *ioffptr,
                           enum PP_State next_state)
{
  char *buf = (char *) &pp[1];
  size_t newline;

  newline = 0;
  while ( (newline < pp->buffer_pos) &&
          (buf[newline] != '\r') &&
          (buf[newline] != '\n') )
    newline++;
  if (newline == pp->buffer_size)
  {
    pp->state = PP_Error;
    return MHD_NO;              /* out of memory */
  }
  if (newline == pp->buffer_pos)
    return MHD_NO;              /* will need more data */
  if (0 == newline)
  {
    /* empty line - end of headers */
    pp->skip_rn = RN_Full;
    pp->state = next_state;
    return MHD_YES;
  }
  /* got an actual header */
  if (buf[newline] == '\r')
    pp->skip_rn = RN_OptN;
  buf[newline] = '\0';
  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_n_ ("Content-disposition: ",
                                 buf,
                                 MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ ("Content-disposition: ")))
  {
    try_get_value (&buf[MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ ("Content-disposition: ")],
                   "name",
                   &pp->content_name);
    try_get_value (&buf[MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ ("Content-disposition: ")],
                   "filename",
                   &pp->content_filename);
  }
  else
  {
    try_match_header ("Content-type: ",
                      MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ ("Content-type: "),
                      buf,
                      &pp->content_type);
    try_match_header ("Content-Transfer-Encoding: ",
                      MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ ("Content-Transfer-Encoding: "),
                      buf,
                      &pp->content_transfer_encoding);
  }
  (*ioffptr) += newline + 1;
  return MHD_YES;
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
I did not find any use of the Standard Library function memcmp in the supplied code fragments. Details:
- try_get_value: uses strlen, strstr, strchr, malloc, memcpy — memcpy is a copy operation and not memcmp; the code copies a fixed byte count and then NUL-terminates the destination. No memcmp-based string comparison is present.
- MHD_str_equal_caseless_n_: implements character-by-character comparison explicitly (array indexing and charsequalcaseless); it does not call memcmp.
- process_multipart_headers: calls MHD_str_equal_caseless_n_ and try_match_header. The former is shown and safe as noted. The implementation of try_match_header is not provided in the supplied code, so it cannot be examined here; because it is not part of the provided code, I did not (and cannot) mark it as a suspicious fragment. 
Given the supplied code, there are no occurrences of memcmp comparing null-terminated strings to report. If you can supply implementations of try_match_header or any other omitted functions, I can re-check those for memcmp usage.
